careers.title: Software Developer
careers.description: Designs, develops, and maintains software applications for computers and mobile devices. This field requires strong problem-solving skills and proficiency in programming languages.

careers.title: Data Scientist
careers.description: Uses analytical and statistical skills to extract insights and knowledge from data. They help organizations make better decisions by interpreting complex datasets.

careers.title: Mechanical Engineer
careers.description: Designs, builds, and tests mechanical devices and systems, from small components to large machines. This role combines principles of physics, mathematics, and materials science.

careers.title: Registered Nurse
careers.description: Provides direct patient care, administers medications, and educates patients and their families about health conditions. A critical role in the healthcare system.

careers.title: Physiotherapist
careers.description: Helps patients recover from injury, illness, and disability through movement and exercise, manual therapy, and education. Requires a post-graduate degree.

careers.title: Accountant (CPA)
careers.description: Manages financial records, prepares tax returns, and provides financial advice to clients or their employer. The CPA designation is the industry standard.

careers.title: Psychologist
careers.description: Assesses and treats mental and emotional disorders. This career path requires graduate-level education (Master's or Ph.D.) beyond a bachelor's degree.

careers.title: Graphic Designer
careers.description: Creates visual concepts, using computer software or by hand, to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate consumers. They develop the overall layout and production design for advertisements, brochures, magazines, and corporate reports.

careers.title: Architect
careers.description: Plans and designs buildings and other structures. Architects must consider function, safety, and aesthetics. This career requires a professional degree and licensure.

careers.title: Electrician
careers.description: Installs, maintains, and repairs electrical power, communications, lighting, and control systems in homes, businesses, and factories. This is a skilled trade requiring apprenticeship and certification.

careers.title: Web Developer
careers.description: Focuses on the technical construction and functionality of websites and web applications. This includes front-end (user-facing) and back-end (server-side) development.

careers.title: Teacher (K-12)
careers.description: Educates students at the elementary or secondary level. Requires a Bachelor of Education degree and certification. Subject specialization is necessary for secondary education.

careers.title: Police Officer
careers.description: Maintains law and order, protects members of the public and their property, prevents crime, and improves the quality of life for all citizens. Requires extensive physical and psychological testing.

careers.title: Environmental Scientist
careers.description: Uses knowledge of the natural sciences to protect the environment and human health. They may clean up polluted areas, advise policymakers, or work with industry to reduce waste.

careers.title: Veterinarian
careers.description: Cares for the health of animals. They diagnose, treat, and research medical conditions and diseases of pets, livestock, and other animals. Requires a Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree.

careers.title: Marketing Manager
careers.description: Plans, directs, or coordinates marketing policies and programs, such as determining the demand for products and services offered by a firm and its competitors, and identify potential customers.

careers.title: Civil Engineer
careers.description: Designs, builds, and supervises infrastructure projects and systems in the public and private sector, including roads, buildings, airports, tunnels, dams, bridges, and systems for water supply and sewage treatment.

careers.title: Pharmacist
careers.description: Dispenses prescription medications to patients and offers expertise in the safe use of prescriptions. They also may conduct health and wellness screenings, provide immunizations, and provide advice on healthy lifestyles.
